text: The food had hairs in it. They're very stingy with there sauces. Don't wear proper hair nets in kitchen so don't be surprised if you find a hair are two in your meal !!! When you walk in they don't greet you how you'd like

Really happy with this place, my boyfriend and I ordered the 10 piece chicken fingers with half order tossed in hot and the other half tossed in the creamy parmesan garlic. Which the 10 piece is a perfect amount for 2 people by the way. Also ordered a small fry, which are skinny beer battered and they are awesome! Everything came out hot, really hot. My only recommendation to the place is the deli paper they serve the chicken on gets soggy. For us with the chicken fingers we wanted to dig in right away but being fresh out of the fryer we used a fork and knife to cut the sauced tenders and that's when the deli paper tears and your getting bites of paper. Its probably not a problem with the wings because let's face something ain't right if a person is cutting into a chicken wing, those are meant to be hand held. So only recommendation is to change the deli paper they serve the chicken on, especially the sauced tenders. I will be returning though to try the chili and other saucey flavors!!
It was alright. Fries good but the chicken a bit soggy. Really good sauces. They want to charge 50 cents for every sauce though. I'd go back if I was drunk or really hungry.

I absolutely love Chicken Shack but do not come to the Rainbow location. We decided to go because we were across town running around doing errands. We all ordered 3 piece wings and 3 fingers combo. The fingers were cooked hot and fresh and the wings were cold like they were prepared earlier and then sauce was added as the orders came in. Or fries were old room temperature fries. I don't understand because I've been to 2 more of their locations and haven't had an issue at all. I brought my dad to show him how good it was but he wasn't impressed and doesn't ever want to try it again. Bummer. The valle verde and sunset location is always busy and has super fresh hot food! They have great customer service at those locations as well. Definitely check out the other locations.
Omg. Very good wings. Crunchy and very flavorful. I had the honey garlic and creamy garlic Parmesan. So good. I really wanted to go back for more. Didn't want to be greedy

First time there. 
Was told  everything is made fresh  there. My order was ready in less than 3 minutes so I questioned it. I was told they blanch them first then finish them off to order. Well that's crap! Makes no sense. They were dry, tough and the breading had no flavor. I bought blue cheese and it was only half full. The chili was small for the price and is mediocre.  Not going back!!!
Tried for the first time and it was really good ! I got 5 Sweet Chili fingers and my boyfriend got the triple shack burger . We really enjoyed it and will be ordering again soon !!!

We stopped here on our way back from touring the Hoover Dam. It's a small place with some indoor dining and some outdoor picnic tables. While it doesn't look like much, the food and service are fantastic! Raising Cane's wishes it were this good. They have excellent chicken tenders and an expansive list of sauces for dipping. If you like the sauce at Raising Cane's, try the spicy ranch here. If you're hungry for some great chicken, look no further!

3.5 star because the seasoning on one of my chicken orders was too salty..it tasted like gallon of salt was added to the wings and it was not hot off the fryer when it came out , so three 3.5 stars for now. I did like the fact that it's not greasy and very crunch texture on the outside and moist on the inside. Overall , I would return and try their other flavors and hopefully the chicken is hot off the fryer on my next visit.

Came in the first time today and just ordered chicken wings with teriyaki sauce the wings were very well then the fries that come with it or in small Cuts so they are nice and crunchy Sharon was our hostess she was very nice the place is very clean atmosphere is very warm great radio station if you love 60s and 70 music I would recommend this place to anyone
Wow! I consider myself a chicken finger expert and these fingers are LEGIT! Great service, smiling faces, and big sides of ranch! Thank you!

Try this place because it was close to home, and that wasn't my brightest idea. If you like fried everything, I'm sure that this place is the bomb. It's just not for me. The people are nice, the service was good, the place was clean, and there's plenty of convenient parking.

Bomb! Best chili cheese fries I've had in forever. I had the honey habanero sauce and it was pretty tasty. Not the cheapest and they charge you extra for ranch and stuff, but that's okay. My new go to for wings.

Chicken Shack has hit the west side, just in time to be my go-to takeout order for football season! With their ridiculously awesome selection of over 25 sauces, there's a flavor for everyone, whether you're looking to dip your wings, chicken, or fries. The friendly young staff and vaguely southern decor with corrugated metal and license plates almost trick me into thinking I'm back at Plucker's wing bar in San Marcos, Texas. Short of a plane ride, this is as close as I can get, and that's a huge compliment.

All the chicken orders are made fresh with never-frozen chicken, and their batter is in that Goldilocks area of being neither too thick or too thin. Menu also has salads and a handful of sandwiches and sides, but you come here for the chicken. The huge, meaty tenders are my preferred piece but if it's Wednesday, you'll catch me cleaning their wings down to the bone. Combo portions are as big as the wide-open hill country sky, with SIX wings, FIVE tenders, or the half-and-half option, any which can easily make two small lunches. 

My favorite sauces are spicy honey garlic (gotta love those little bits of garlic!), Jamaican Jerk (slow, building heat), the creamy garlic parm (cheesy and cooling), and the spicy bleu cheese (for the best of both worlds)- I always get sauces on the side so I can dip, otherwise they'll toss your order, so be sure to specify!

This place is the best. I'd recommend over canes. They hand batter the chicken to order so it's always fresh. The fries are made in butter so they're super buttery and delicious and crispy. Everything is made fresh to order. Every time we've gone we've never been disappointed. The customer service is always pretty great and their sauces are all homemade and super tasty. The only downside are the drinks because their soda machine isn't the best. The chicken wings and fingers are pretty huge compared to like bww or canes or any other place. Definitely recommend!

My chicken tenders were dry and the breading came off all of them as I tried picking them up. What else might be left to add? 

The restaurant is small & cute and they have great side sauces like ranch and honey mustard along with many other options but I like eating food that tastes fresh and delicious. The skinny fries are ok but didn't do it for me either. I found my fries to be incredibly salty. 

I think that if you make one thing you should make it really well. 

I also think other similar chains offer better quality of food and lower prices. The end.

Sooo bomb. I got the 3 finger combo & had them put the mild sauce over the fingers, SHIT. The mild was kinda spicy but sweet at the same time. The fries were kinda salty but tasted good with the ranch. Speaking of the ranch, they have really good ranch. The ranch says a lot to me about the quality of the place. My boyfriend got the 5 piece finger with hot bbq over them. Reminded me of Buffalo Wild Wings honey bbq boneless wings, but better. S
Tasty wings & strips. The wife variety of sauces was awesome. Came on a Sunday, the gal at the front was really nice.

This is my favorite chicken fingers place, huge chicken portions and the best fries I've ever had. Friendly service and loved the 70s classic rock music . They have a lot of great sauces to choose from I try new one every time I come in.
Yay! Finally one in Spring Valley. I grew up going to the one in Henderson, so happy that they are expanding. Best Chicken Fingers!
Really good chicken, good prtions, friendly staff. First time here but definately NOT my last.

Fried chicken! Who doesnt love it? Its the best way to eat chicken in my opinion. 
Came here obviously to try the chicken- walked in and decor is very cute with all different cute jokes about why the chicken crossed the road. 
Menu consists of: Wings, chicken fingers, burgers, sanwhiches, salads, fries
Side: baked beans, potato salad, Mac salad, Cole slaw veggie sticks 
Homemade chili bowls

We had the sweet chili and garlic Parmesan, Breaded wings. NGL I was concerned about the breaded wings because most placed OVER bread the wings and its too chewy. They dont make naked wings, so I was forced to get the breaded wings.
I was very SURPRISED to find they were only lighly breaded and VERY VERY crispy! Absolutely delicious! 
6 piece wings are:  7.29$- kinda pricey but worth it
They also gave us a free extra wing (idk if that was on purpose)- see pics there are 7 instead of 6


WISH LIST: Wish they had a wing happy hour! And beers would be nice

Will be back!
Some of the best wings in Las Vegas. Perfect place to order wings for your football party!

First off I want to start off with is customer service is great, young lady had a smile on her face,was open to any questions we had as well. 

Ok so I'm not sure if it's just me, but Breaded wings just don't do it for me. I just went for a simple wing craving, but left very unsatisfied.
Didn't really think they were fresh wings either.
 
I have forever been looking for a place where they serve lemon pepper wings that's a sauce instead of a rub. Which I was led to believe they had it here because under sauces lemon pepper was right underneath. 
The breading  of the wings took to much of the flavor from the lemon pepper. Also they were a bit too dry as well.

If you're a person who digs the breading by all means. But I think I'll stick to Wingstop and Buffalo wild wings for my wing cravings.

I don't know where some of these bad reviews about the chicken being dry and such but I guess they changed things up cause my chicken fingers were thick and juicy and yes I would say they are waaay better than Caine's. The staff was very nice and I would come back here again!

Had the 3 piece combo. Quality of product is excellent, chicken is tender and juicy, fries excellent as well. All came out hot and fresh. Service was exceptional-you can tell the ownership cares about their customers and the quality of their product. Highly recommend this location!

First time. Picked up chicken strips and chili for lunch. Got the 5 piece chicken. Very good. I prefer traditional fried chicken with a good crust and bones...but this was excellent. At first I thought $7.00+ for a 'large' chili might be a bit too much...it didn't seem all that 'large'. But when I got it back to the office I was so impressed with the quality that the $$$$ seemed fair (you get what you pay for someone once said). Very good -- with beans -- but they are minimal. All in all it was great quality, and excellent, friendly service. Can't wait to try the wings and some of the sides.

I love the chicken Shack the food is really good and is always hot and fresh!!! I come in all the time to the location in henderson. The young man at the counter is always so nice! I just like the chicken wings with ranch. I get the wings with hot buffalo sauce. My bkyfriend gets the hot bbq. 
I wish the to go didnt come in Styrofoam thats my only pet peeve because it makes tje friws hard to eat

I have been wanting to try this place for awhile. So I Tried it yeasterday. I ordered a 6 piece wing combo with fries and a drink,6 more wing and fries and a 5 piece chicken finger for $34.10. Seems like a lot of money. But for the amount of food it's not. The wings are huge and the chicken fingers are huge too. I could only eat 3 wings and half of my fries. The wings taste like chicken. I have had wings before that have no flavor. They are so good and crispy if you get certain ones. The people there are nice and friendly. I ordered for a take out when I got there. I waited for it. There were very fast making my food. It was hot. And the cook came out of the kitchen and gave me my food personally. I definitely will be back here to eat again. Great place!!

I had the six piece chicken combo with sweet chili sauce. $9.59
Small cute and tidy place . You may not get the parking space you want because there are several other popular eateries in this complex.
Customer service is friendly .
Too may sauces to mention.
Here's the basic cut to the chase review compared to those other chicken wing places - it seemed to me that chicken shack uses a better quality chicken and therefore the end product is a better tasting chicken .
Also extra extra extra thanks for having wet towelettes to wipe your fingers . The other places don't offer those .

Cool place, cool guys behind the counter.  
Combo meals are a good deal for lunch. They have a good selection of dipping sauces and the containers are plenty big so it was more than enough for me. Chicken fingers are plump and tasty. Teeny tiny shoe string fries that I don't care for because I like steak fries much better, but I will admit they are tasty.
Simple dining room to eat in and the counter guy even asked me how the food was and I gave him the international thumbs up. They play classic rock music which is amazing.
This Chicken Shack rocks!!
"I'll be back"

I usually would go to the Henderson location and order fingers only so I was super stoked that they opened one nearby my house, However, when I went to this location, I noticed that they raised the menu prices so that was a bummer. I took my family with me and told my husband he would love this place (He's a wing guy) he was so disappointed that the wings were breaded and the chicken fingers were so dry and tough, The Fries were a bit salty as well.

I really liked the concept. The honey BBQ sauce seems like it's made with real honey so it was a good idea. However the chicken fingers were not cooked to perfection. The meat tasted over cooked and dry. At least raising canes cooks their chicken perfect almost every time so if they can master their cooking game it would be a 5.

FINALLY a Chicken Shack on the southwest side of town (not in Henderson). Happy to report they still have the same high level of quality as the original. Best fingers in town and some very good fries as well. Try the mild and medium sauces. They're fantastic!
So very happy that they have location 5 minutes from house. Now I can have them more than just only when I go to Boulder City
Ok so far the best chicken I've had in a very long time!!! The service was great..... The wait time was short. The establishment was very neat and clean. I'm in love

Really really good chicken fingers! Nice sauce selections and I like the menu variety. Burgers here are great...thin and great beef burger flavor...and on an onion roll.  Service is fast and the staff behind the counter are friendly and have a sense if humor. Great find just beware...hard to get a parking spot.

Good price and good fried  chicken. If you're in the area and looking for a quick bite they fit the bill. Price is right for what you get. A little on the bland side but not too bad. It's fast fried chicken don't go in expecting a whole lot. Lol

Our food was ok. We ordered a 10 piece chicken strip with fries and some wings. The strips were thick and juicy but lacked flavor. The sauces were pretty tasty though... overall I probably would choose another chicken place like canes.

The food here is wonderful. We were pleasantly surprised with this place. It was very clean and the food was great. The wings were awesome especially with the spicy blue cheese. Ranch dressing was good too.

This is probably my new favorite chicken spot! Chicken is tender and lightly breaded. They don't douse your food in sauce (unless asked) and have the option of fingers or wings. Get the #4 if you want both !

First time going here yesterday. This place offers chicken tenders, chicken wings, and other dishes such as chili, burgers, chicken sandwich, and salads as well. Located on rainbow and Tropicana. The place was super clean. Went with the combination chicken tender basket with fries. They make their fries shoestring style, and you had a choice of sauce on the side. Chicken you can get regular battered, or with your choice of sauce on top. The tenders and fries came it crispy, with the chicken specifically battered great. Paired it with ranch, my bf went with the fry sauce (mayo and ketchup combined, soo good!!) service was friendly. They also have customer rewards, make sure to grab a card at the cashier- buy 10 get a meal free.
For a chicken place it's great they have like 20 sauces and rubs and like more than 5 side's.

I like the decor in the inside of of restaurant but I would prefer going to Cane's or even Dairy Queen for better chicken strips and fries. Everything smelled delicious when I ordered it and the customer service was great, but the food did not deliver.

I ordered a 3 piece chicken strip combo with fries and a drink. My lemonade from the drink machine first tasted weird, then my fries were hella oily, and the strips were salty. The cashier suggested at check-out to try the different sauces on the side, and they were delicious.Two sauces come with the combo but the food was a huge disappointment.

I doubt if I will ever return to this eating establishment because I've had better chicken at Wendy's and other fat food chains.

This is the second time I've tried "The Chicken Shack". I have to admit that the product they use in their preparations is top shelf, the wings were plump and juicy (I've seen smaller drumsticks!). I also like the crunchy nature of their recipe. Still, two things disappoint me, one the crunchiness of the product is diminished by the buildup of steam in their to go packaging. Also, they lack charisma at the point of sale, I wish the employees enjoyed themselves more.

I work in the pharmaceutical industry, and do a lot of catered lunch and learns at doctors offices on the daily, so I'm very picky about takeout. This place is the first place I have ever ventured to yelp about... that's how good it is.
Before my life in pharma sales, right after graduate school; 
I even opened one of those, "don't believe the hype", over-priced chicken restaurants on the strip. This chicken was as good, if not better than the southern-style chicken restaurant that I opened on the strip in Vegas!!!  Don't waste your time with anyplace else Vegas! Plus, as a former cocktail server, I'm picky about service, and this place was top notch! 

The only time that an entire doctors office has given me rave reviews for the catering!

I am so so so disappointed after my latest experience tonight. I ordered a 20 piece finger meal and a large fries. They offer 4 "free" dipping sauces ( I got our chicken plain) and they have like 15-20 sauces to choose from, BUT they charge for ranch and honey mustard...how do they offer so many flavors but charge for the staples?? It felt bad greedy!! To charge for the most popular sauces for chicken fingers so they know they can get a couple of extra bucks out of you feels shady. Then when I get home and feed it to my family the chicken tasted like it was fried in really old or burnt oil and had such an unpleasant taste and even worse aftertaste.... my kids don't even want to eat it. I spent close to 40-50 bucks (  my bill came to 63 dollars because of misunderstanding on my order so 20 was refunded and then charged an additional charge, because of this I am unsure of the amount of my bill,) but I assume its pretty close to $50. I think this will be my last visit! Super disappointing. They did have great employees who were kind and inviting. Still, that will not make up for bad tasting chicken and greedy additional charges.

I have been waiting for The Chicken Shack to open since I saw the signs about a month ago. This new  location on Rainbow is great for your chicken cravings. Deliciously juicy chicken fingers and wings for a good price. Wings are quite large. My boyfriend and I were able to share three fingers and a few wings. Ask for sauces on the side as the chicken is fine and a bit salty (and oily) on its own. That is probably the only downfall but good in an unhealthy way ha. Shoe string fries have a nice crunch.
Just opened recently, great food and awesome customer service.  The fingers are my favorite by far. Will be back

My first time at the Chicken Shack great little concept lot of fun good energy very tasty food. I ordered the Cajun wings as well as lemon pepper with celery sticks and carrots instead of fries; to stay healthy. Then they gave me a nice little sampling of the damn hot sauce with habanero and jalapeno ground up chili great kit great flavor really enjoy this place I will be back.
The chicken was good but the fries are thin and get cold fast,for what little food you get.. its pretty pricey. But at least we can say we have tried this place out.

I have to say that I am VERY picky when it comes to my french fries and let me tell you I fell in love with these fries at first taste! I got 3 wings and 3 fingers with fries and a drink. I had a very hard time getting through 2 wings and a chicken finger because I filled up on the amazing fries! I cant wait to come back and try another one of their sauces

We love chicken shack! It was our first visit to this location and it's been the best so far! We are in love with the fry sauce to the point where we could almost drink it right out of the cup! The chicken tenders always come our fresh, hot and huge! Their ranch is to die for! We also just tried the honey garlic sauce on the wings and there's no coming back from that one #honeygarlicforlife so dang good! So excited that this location is literally 2 mins from our new place so we will be able to go often!

Came here on a Monday night craving some wings. For two people we ordered 3 orders of the 6 piece wings because the orders either came in 6, 12 or 25 with nothing in between. We got the creamy garlic Parmesan, chipotle bbq and hot honey garlic. 

Wings came out relatively fast and they are actually really big!  My favorite flavor was the hot honey garlic. A little spicy and a little sweet. The chipotle bbq was sweet as well. I liked it but I'm not sure if chipotle is supposed to be sweet or not.   I was expecting something a little more savory and Smokey. The garlic Parmesan was also good but it got a little heavy towards the end. I'm glad we had other flavors to break up the taste. 

I will definitely come back here again as wings are big and well priced and the flavors are pretty good!

Yelp told me this place was hot and new. 

If by hot they mean completely over cooked and dry chicken band burnt buns, and new they mean completely new to the operating of a fryer... Then sure. This place is hot and new. 

The only thing remotely redeeming is the fries. Thin cut and crispy... So really burnt but I like crispy fries.
Great service, great chicken, great variety of sauces. Love pretty good French fries.
Delicious, plump chicken fingers.  Tasty sauces.  The best I have ever had.  Chick fil a should take note of the size of these chicken fingers.

Geez! I am pretty positive this is the right location. I stopped in to get a to go order while running errands...oil change etc. I don't remember the young pretty girl that helped me maybe she was wearing a name tag and I forgot or didn't pay attention but she was very nice and helpful. Thank you so much for great service. If I am around town I will have to check out other chicken shakes. I am almost certain this was the location on my side of town. Thank you.

I went here because my friend suggested it. I was not impressed by the food or customer service. When we walked up to the counter, the cashier didn't even greet us or ask if we had questions about the menu. She just stared until I told her I was ready to order. She wasn't wearing a name tag, but according to the receipt, her name was "Cheri". I ordered 12 wings - half lemon pepper and half garlic parmesan. It was overly breaded and it looked like they just dumped the garlic parmesan on top. The coating didn't stick. They charged 59 cents for a small container of ranch. I don't think I'll come back for a second time.
My favorite chicken in Vegas. Chicken is not overly seasoned yet still favorable. Given a little more time, they will be as good as Sunset location.

Best chicken place in Vegas hands down , no one comes close they fast friendly staff, food is always fresh never had no problem , very good place to go , new location on rainbow and trop, go there try it out u won't be disappointed i guaranteed u that , if so then u are use to that face chicken u get from Mac Donald's lol

Finally a Chicken Shack on the West side. Known as the best local chicken restaurant in Green Valley! After eating here and tasting the quality you won't want to go to a Raising Cane's or Popeye's. Huge difference in freshness and taste!
I'm so excited they opened one on this side of town! Now I can come here all the time for lunch during the work week. Everyone is really nice here and the place is super clean!

Had stop in for the amazing sauce(s) and homemade chili. 

Tried a few new sauces today. All where yummy and delicious.
